statements.name: PROC GPLOT
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the plot variables. Can specify uniform axis scaling for all graphs as well as an annotate data set and an output catalog.
statements.help:
PROC GPLOT 
            DATA=input-data-set
	
            <ANNOTATE=Annotate-data-set>
	
            <GOUT=<libref.>output-catalog>
	<IMAGEMAP=                      output-data-set>
	
            <UNIFORM>; 
	                   BUBBLE 
               plot-request(s)
               </                         options>; 
		BUBBLE2 
                  plot-request(s)
                  </                            options>;
            
            
	PLOT 
               plot-request(s)
               </                         options>; 
		PLOT2 
                  plot-request(s)
                  </                            options>;
            
            
	ATTRIB  variable-list(s) 
               attribute-list(s);
            
	BY 
               <DESCENDING>
               variable-1
		< ...
                        <DESCENDING>
                        variable-n>
               
		<NOTSORTED>;
            
            
	FORMAT 
               variable-1
               < ...variable-n>
               <format-1>
               <variable-1< ...variable-n><format-2>>
                ...
               <DEFAULT=default-format>;
            
	LABEL 
               variable-1=label-1 | ' '
               <variable-n=label-n | ' '>
                ...;
            
	NOTE <text-arguments(s)>;
            
	QUIT ;
            
	WHERE 
               where-expression;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variables to plot. By default, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GPLOT procedure.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output that is produced by the GPLOT procedure. If you omit the libref, SAS/GRAPH looks for the catalog in the temporary library called WORK and creates the catalog if it does not exist.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: creates a temporary SAS data set that is used to generate an image map.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: specifies that the same axis scaling is used for all graphs that are produced by the procedure. The same axis scaling would apply across Run-groups as well. By default, the range of axis values for each axis is based on the minimum and maximum values in the data. Therefore, they can vary from graph to graph and among BY groups. Using the UNIFORM option forces the value range for each axis to be the same for all graphs. Take for example, a procedure that produces multiple graphs with both left and right vertical axes. The UNIFORM option scales all of the left axes the same and all of the right axes the same. The scaling is based on the minimum and maximum data values.

statements.name: BUBBLE
statements.description: Creates bubble plots in which a third variable is plotted against two variables represented by the horizontal and vertical axes; the value of the third variable controls the size of the bubble.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the left vertical axis.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: bubble-size
arguments.description: variable that specifies the size of the bubbles. Bubble-size must be numeric. If the value of bubble-size is positive, bubbles are drawn with a solid line. If it is negative, bubbles are drawn with a dashed line.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GPLOT procedure.

arguments.name: AUTOHREF
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: AUTOVREF
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the bubbles.

arguments.name: BFILL=
arguments.description: enables you to generate solid or gradient-filled bubbles.

arguments.name: BFONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font to use for bubble labels.

arguments.name: BLABEL
arguments.description: labels the bubbles with the values of the third variable.

arguments.name: BSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies whether the bubble-scaling proportion is based on the area of the circles or the radius measure.

arguments.name: BSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies an overall scaling factor for the bubbles so that you can increase or decrease the size of all bubbles by this factor.

arguments.name: CAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies colors for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the horizontal axis, as specified by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: CAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the axis line and all major and minor tick marks.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: fills the axis area with the specified color.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn perpendicular to the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies the color for all text on the axes, including tick mark values, axis labels, and bubble labels.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: DATAORDER=
arguments.description: plots character of midpoint-type data in data order instead of the default alphabetical order.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: specifies that reference lines drawn by the AUTOREF or REF= options should be drawn in front of the bars.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on both axes.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies major tick mark values for the horizontal axis or assigns a global axis definition.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks that are drawn between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: draws one or more reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal axis at points that are specified by value-list.

arguments.name: HREVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the order of the values on the horizontal axis be reversed.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HZERO
arguments.description: specifies that tick marks on the horizontal axis begin in the first position or end in the last position with a value of zero, depending on the horizontal variable values.

arguments.name: IFRAME=
arguments.description: identifies the image file you that want to apply to the axis area of the plot.

arguments.name: IMAGESTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use multiple instances of an image to fill the axis area (TILE) or to stretch a single instance of an image to fill the axis area (FIT).

arguments.name: LAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line type for reference lines at major tick marks on the horizontal axis, as specified by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: LAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies a line type for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as specified by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines drawn perpendicular to the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines drawn perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses the axes, including axis lines, axis labels, all major and minor tick marks, and tick mark values.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is not drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the major tick mark values for the vertical axis or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks that are drawn between each major tick mark on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: draws one or more reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at specified points.

arguments.name: VREVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the order of the values on the vertical axis should be reversed.

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: specifies that tick marks on the vertical axis begin in the first position or end in the last position with a value of zero, depending on the vertical variable values.

arguments.name: WAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for all reference lines at major tick marks on the horizontal axis as determined by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: WAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for all reference lines at major tick marks on the vertical axis as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: WHREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines as determined by the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: WVREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines as determined by the vertical axis.

statements.name: BUBBLE2
statements.description: Creates a second vertical axis on the right side of a graph produced by an accompanying BUBBLE or PLOT statement. A second variable can be plotted against this axis.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the right vertical axis; typically it is different from y-variable in the accompanying BUBBLE or PLOT statement.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis; it is the same as x-variable in the accompanying BUBBLE or PLOT statement.

arguments.name: bubble-size
arguments.description: specifies the size of the bubbles. Bubble-size must be numeric. If the value of bubble-size is positive, bubbles are drawn with a solid line. If it is negative, bubbles are drawn with a dashed line.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GPLOT procedure.

arguments.name: AUTOVREF
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the bubbles.

arguments.name: BFILL=
arguments.description: enables you to generate solid or gradient-filled bubbles.

arguments.name: BFONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font to use for bubble labels.

arguments.name: BLABEL
arguments.description: labels the bubbles with the values of the third variable.

arguments.name: BSCALE=
arguments.description: specifies whether the bubble-scaling proportion is based on the area of the circles or the radius measure.

arguments.name: BSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies an overall scaling factor for the bubbles so that you can increase or decrease the size of all bubbles by this factor.

arguments.name: CAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the axis line and all major and minor tick marks.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: fills the axis area with the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies the color for all text on the axes, including tick mark values, axis labels, and bubble labels.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: DATAORDER=
arguments.description: plots character of midpoint-type data in data order instead of the default alphabetical order.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: specifies that reference lines drawn by the AUTOREF or REF= options should be drawn in front of the bars.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on both axes.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies a line type for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as specified by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines drawn perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses the axes, including axis lines, axis labels, all major and minor tick marks, and tick mark values.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is not drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the major tick mark values for the vertical axis or assigns specified global AXIS statement definitions to the axis.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks that are drawn between each major tick mark on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: draws one or more reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at specified points.

arguments.name: VREVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the order of the values on the vertical axis should be reversed.

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: specifies that tick marks on the vertical axis begin in the first position or end in the last position with a value of zero, depending on the vertical variable values.

arguments.name: WAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for all reference lines at major tick marks on the vertical axis as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: WVREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines as determined by the vertical axis.

statements.name: PLOT
statements.description: Creates plots in which one variable is plotted on the horizontal axis and a second variable is plotted on the left vertical axis.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the left vertical axis.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of the nth generated SYMBOL definition.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the left vertical axes.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the horizontal axes.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the left vertical axis.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: third-variable
arguments.description: classification variable against which y-variable and x-variable are plotted. Third-variable can be character or numeric, but numeric variables should contain discrete rather than continuous values, or should be formatted to provide discrete values.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all graphs that are produced by the GPLOT procedure.

arguments.name: AREAS=
arguments.description: fills all the areas below plot line n with a pattern.

arguments.name: AUTOHREF
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: AUTOVREF
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all of the major tick marks on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: CAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies colors for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the horizontal axis, as specified by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: CAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the axis line and all major and minor tick marks.

arguments.name: CBASELINE=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the horizontal baseline for reference lines of a plot.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: fills the axis area with the specified color.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn perpendicular to the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the outline that is drawn around filled areas.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for all text on the axes and legend, including axis labels, tick mark values, legend labels, and legend value descriptions.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the color of reference lines drawn perpendicular to the vertical axis.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: FRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: specifies that reference lines drawn by the AUTOREF or REF= options should be drawn in front of the bars.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: draws reference lines at all major tick marks on both axes.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies major tick mark values for the horizontal axis or assigns a global axis definition.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks drawn between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HREF=
arguments.description: draws one or more reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal axis at points that are specified by value-list.

arguments.name: HREVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the order of the values on the horizontal axis be reversed.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HZERO
arguments.description: specifies that tick marks on the horizontal axis begin in the first position or end in the last position with a value of zero, depending on the horizontal variable values.

arguments.name: IFRAME=
arguments.description: identifies the image file that you want to apply to the axis area of the plot.

arguments.name: IMAGESTYLE=
arguments.description: specifies whether to use multiple instances of the image to fill the axis area (TILE) or to stretch a single instance of the image to fill the (FIT). The TILE value is the default.

arguments.name: LAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies a line type for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the horizontal axis, as specified by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: LAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies a line type for reference lines drawn at major tick marks on the vertical axis, as specified by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: LEGEND
arguments.description: generates a legend or specifies the defined global legend to use for the plot.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the legend statement number.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: generates a legend or specifies the defined global legend to use for the plot.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the legend statement number.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: specifies line types for reference lines drawn perpendicular to the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the type of reference lines drawn with the AUTOVREF, VREF, and GRID options.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses the axes, including axis lines, axis labels, all major and minor tick marks, and tick mark values.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: specifies that a line is not drawn around the axis area.

arguments.name: NOLASTAREA
arguments.description: removes the last area of a plot when the value specified by the AREAS= option exceeds the number of bounded areas in the plot.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend that is generated by a plot request of the type y-variable*x-variable=third-variable.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: places all the plots that are generated by the PLOT statement on one set of axes.

arguments.name: REGEQN
arguments.description: displays the regression equation that is specified in the INTERPOL= option of the SYMBOL statement in the lower left corner of the plot.

arguments.name: SKIPMISS
arguments.description: breaks a plot line or an area fill at occurrences of missing values of the Y variable.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: specifies the major tick mark values for the vertical axis or assigns a global axis definition.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: specifies the number of minor tick marks that are drawn between each major tick mark on the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: draws one or more reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at specified points.

arguments.name: VREVERSE
arguments.description: specifies that the order of the values on the vertical axis be reversed.

arguments.name: VZERO
arguments.description: specifies that tick marks on the vertical axis begin in the first position or end in the last position with a value of zero, depending on the vertical variable values.

arguments.name: WAUTOHREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for all reference lines at major tick marks on the horizontal axis as determined by the AUTOHREF option.

arguments.name: WAUTOVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the line width for all reference lines at major tick marks on the vertical axis as determined by the AUTOVREF option.

arguments.name: WHREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines as determined by the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: WVREF=
arguments.description: specifies line widths for reference lines as determined by the vertical axis.

statements.name: PLOT2
statements.description: Produces one or more plots with the vertical axis on the right side of the graph against which a second variable can be plotted.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the right vertical axis.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: number of the nth generated SYMBOL definition.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the right vertical axes.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the horizontal axes.

arguments.description: specifies the legend statement number.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: specifies the type of reference lines drawn with the AUTOVREF, VREF, and GRID options.

arguments.name: NOAXIS
arguments.description: suppresses the axes, including axis lines, axis labels, all major and minor tick marks, and tick mark values.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

arguments.name: ALT=
arguments.description: specifies descriptive text for a URL to which a note links, or the note itself.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the baseline of the entire text string with respect to the horizontal.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of a box produced by the BOX= option.

arguments.name: BLANK=
arguments.description: protects the box and its contents from being overwritten by any subsequent graphics elements.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: draws a box around one line of text.

arguments.name: BSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between the boxed text and the box.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the following text, box, or line.

arguments.name: DRAW=
arguments.description: draws lines anywhere on the graphics output area.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the subsequent text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of text characters in number of units.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: LANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the entire text-string(s).

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies a uniform resource locator (URL) to which a note links.

arguments.name: LSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing above and below lines of text.

arguments.name: MOVE=
arguments.description: positions a text string.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated.

arguments.name: UNDERLIN=
arguments.description: underlines subsequent text.

arguments.name: WRAP
arguments.description: wraps the text to a second line if the text does not fit on one line.

arguments.name: #BYLINE
arguments.description: substitutes the entire BY line without leading or trailing blanks for #BYLINE in the text string. It also displays the BY line in the note produced by the statement.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
